com.DivineInspiration.experimenter.Controller

Class UserManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.DivineInspiration.experimenter.Controller.UserManager

  • public class UserManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class talks to the FireStore database in order to store and retrieve user data. It also manages the storage of user data locally on the device. The class uses singleton pattern.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  UserManager.ContextNotSetException
      An exception that gets thrown if we have no local user data
      static interface  UserManager.OnUserListReadyListener
      When user datum is retrieved from database is ready, it is passed along as a parameter by the interface method.
      static interface  UserManager.OnUserReadyListener
      When user data is retrieved from database is ready, it is passed along as a parameter by the interface method.

        expId - ID of experiment

      • updateUser

        public void updateUser(User newUser,
                       UserManager.OnUserReadyListener callback)
        Updates (or creates if not existing) the local user. This method will update the user stored in memory, locally, and in FireStore. If the user's Id already exist, then the exist user document will be updated(replaced). Notes: 1. Changing user id or creating new users requires UserReadyCalled to be registered to LocalUserManager 2. Upon changing user id, user should be given the option to permanently delete the old profile. Then be switched to the new profile
        Parameters:
        newUser - user to be made or updated
        callback - The user data is passed as a parameter of the method in the callback
        Throws:
        UserManager.ContextNotSetException - throws exception if no context has ever been set for this LocalUserManager
